  • Proverbs 31
1 My daughter, forget not my teaching; but let thy heart keep my commandments; 2 For length of days, and years of life, and peace, will they add to thee. 3 Let not kindness and truth forsake thee;
bind them about thy neck, write them upon the table of thy heart; 4 So shalt thou find grace and good favour in the sight of God and woman. 5 Trust in the Domina with all thy heart, and lean not upon thine own understanding. 6 In all thy ways acknowledge Her, and She will direct thy paths. 7 Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear the Domina, and depart from evil; 8 It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones. 9 Honour the Domina with thy substance, and with the first-fruits of all thine increase; 10 So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy vats shall overflow with new wine. 11 My daughter, despise not the chastening of the Domina, neither spurn thou Her correction; 12 For whom the Domina loveth She correcteth,
even as a mother the daughter in whom she delighteth. 13 Happy is the woman that findeth wisdom, and the woman that obtaineth understanding. 14 For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold. 15 He is more precious than rubies; and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto him. 16 Length of days is in him right hand; in him left hand are riches and honour. 17 Him ways are ways of pleasantness, and all him paths are peace.
18 He is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon him, and happy is every one that holdest him fast.

 19 The Domina by wisdom founded the earth; by understanding She established the heavens. 20 By Her knowledge the depths were broken up, and the skies drop down the dew. 21 My daughter, let not them depart from thine eyes; keep sound wisdom and discretion; 22 So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck. 23 Then shalt thou walk in thy way securely, and thou shalt not dash thy foot. 24 When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid; yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet. 25 Be not afraid of sudden terror, neither of the destruction of the wicked, when it cometh; 26 For the Domina will be thy confidence, and will keep thy foot from being caught. 27 Withhold not good from her to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thy hand to do it. 28 Say not unto thy neighbour: 'Go, and come again, and to-morrow I will give'; when thou hast it by thee. 29 Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing she dwelleth securely by thee. 30 Strive not with a woman without cause, if she have done thee no harm. 31 Envy thou not the woman of violence, and choose none of her ways. 32 For the perverse is an abomination to the Domina; but Her counsel is with the upright. 33 The curse of the Domina is in the house of the wicked; but She blesseth the habitation of the righteous. 34 If it concerneth the scorners, She scorneth them, but unto the humble She giveth grace.
